result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden Elton Currie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Branden Elton Currie in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Branden Elton Currie.
Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference.  
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case scheduled to resolve globally in Branch 19.  Branch 19 has reset the 8/16/2022 plea and sentencing hearing on defendant Branden Currie's cases to 8/30/2022 at 10:30 am.  Reserve Branch 13 rescheduled the case to the same date and time.

Attorney Amanda Kremer for Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Branden Elton Currie not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Court allows for transfer of this case to Br. 45 for global resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 45. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Branden Elton Currie not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense counsel asks that defendant's appearance be waived, granted. 
Defense counsel adivses this case may resolve with a global resolution and asks for a short adjournment. State does not object. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Branden Elton Currie in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Branden Elton Currie in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branden Elton Currie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ITJ
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
